channel.title: My Simple Dev Blog
channel.description: Recent content on My Simple Dev Blog

item.title: Building up WordPress Website on GoDaddy
item.description: 1. Go to GoDaddy, Choose your plan. Get the free domain; After selecting a free domain, Create an account in GoDaddy Following the step to make a payment Check the email to verify the email address, to use the domain just registered 2. Click Go to My Account Under the Web Hosting, go to Set up, then adding Domain Create WordPress account Click Set Up My Site Purchase an SSL certificate to secure the domain and make sure that it’s protected from hackers and other people trying to steal the information Then go to the cPanel admin 3.

item.title: Difference Between Stack and Queue
item.description: Stack Linear data structure; Inserted and deleted only from one side of the list; Insert operation called push operation; Delete operation is called pop operation; LIFO(Last in First Out); Used in solving problems works on recursion; Queue Linear data structure; Inserted only from rear and deleted only from front of the list; Insert operation called enqueue operation; Delete operation is called dequeue operation; FIFO(First in First Out) Used in solving problems having sequential processing;

item.title: The CSS Position Property
item.description: There are five different position values: static relative fixed absolute sticky HTML elements are positioned static by default Relative is positioned relative to its normal position. Fixed is positioned relative to the viewport, which means it always stays in the same place even if the page is scrolled. Position absolute is relative to the nearest positioned ancestor. Sticky is position based on the user’s scroll position.

item.title: Vanilla JS add event listener on multiple elements
item.description: In Vanilla JavaScript, there are multiple ways of addEventListener to elements. Add event listener to one single element: const btn = document.getElementById('btn-section-3'); btn.addEventListener('click', function (event) { console.time('id'); event.preventDefault(); const element = document.getElementById(event.target.dataset.target); element.scrollIntoView(); console.timeEnd('id'); }); Getting the element based on its ID CSS selector; Using addEventListener to listen for click event; Starting a performance timer to keep track of the speed; Doing a simple scrollIntoView to have some animation. Vanilla JavaScript use addEventListener in a for loop: document.

item.title: Building GitHub Page Blog
item.description: Install hugo (mac) Brew install hugo Create two repositories on GitHub and Make them public sjiang20.github.io (going to be used as URL) myblog Clone Blog repositories to local Inside of myblog, create,RUN hugo new site dev-tips Inside of dev-tips, go directly to themes Choose one of the favorite Themes from HUGO official website git clone the Themes from HUGO official website to themes Open up config.
